perturbation.original_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume ("MAOV") of [***] ("Units") for the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage's [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a "Contract Period").
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume ("MAOV") of [***] ("Units") for the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage's [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by March 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a "Contract Period").
perturbation.explanation: Changing the approval deadline to March 1, 2019, after the stated commercial aseptic production date could create a situation where Premier is obligated to purchase a MAOV before having sufficient time to assess and approve Heritage's facility by the contractually mandated date.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding reasonable opportunity to inspect and approve goods or facilities before being obligated to purchase or accept them. This may conflict with the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage's [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019.
perturbation.changed_text: The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, with no contingency for commercial aseptic production at Heritage's [***] facility or approval of that facility by Premier.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the contingency clause altogether forces Premier to purchase the MAOV regardless of whether Heritage achieves commercial aseptic production or Premier approves the facility. This is an extremely unreasonable contract that is now in bad faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding reasonable opportunity to inspect and approve goods or facilities before being obligated to purchase or accept them. This may conflict with the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment No. 1 (the "Amendment"), entered into by and between Stremick's Heritage Foods, LLC ("Heritage") Premier Nutrition Corporation ("Premier") is effective as of June 11, 2018 ("Amendment Effective Date") and amends that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Heritage and Premier dated July 1, 2017 ("Agreement").
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment No. 1 (the "Amendment"), entered into by and between Stremick's Heritage Foods, LLC ("Heritage") Premier Nutrition Corporation ("Premier") is effective as of December 31, 2017 ("Amendment Effective Date") and amends that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Heritage and Premier dated July 1, 2017 ("Agreement").
perturbation.explanation: Changing the Amendment Effective Date to a date prior to the signature date may be considered an inaccurate and misleading representation. Dating a legal document with the intention of misleading, creating a false impression, or obtaining an unfair advantage would be considered fraudulent.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding misrepresentation, fraud, and the requirement for accurate and truthful information in contractual agreements.
